intro: Tanacetum pseudachillea, commonly known as false yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, gray-green leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Tanacetum pseudachillea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
